intro: Centroclinium hyssopifolium, commonly known as the hyssop-leaved centroclinium, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of hyssop. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, which bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
